<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Loop unrolling may create many similar GEPs for array accesses.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// e.g., a 2-level loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// float a&#91;32&#93;&#91;32&#93;; // global variable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for (int i = 0; i &lt; 2; ++i) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   for (int j = 0; j &lt; 2; ++j) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     ... = a&#91;x + i&#93;&#91;y + j&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// will probably be unrolled to:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// gep %a, 0, %x, %y; load</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// gep %a, 0, %x, %y + 1; load</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// gep %a, 0, %x + 1, %y; load</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// gep %a, 0, %x + 1, %y + 1; load</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// LLVM&#39;s GVN does not use partial redundancy elimination yet, and is thus</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// unable to reuse (gep %a, 0, %x, %y). As a result, this misoptimization incurs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// significant slowdown in targets with limited addressing modes. For instance,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// because the PTX target does not support the reg+reg addressing mode, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// NVPTX backend emits PTX code that literally computes the pointer address of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// each GEP, wasting tons of registers. It emits the following PTX for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// first load and similar PTX for other loads.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// mov.u32         %r1, %x;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// mov.u32         %r2, %y;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// mul.wide.u32    %rl2, %r1, 128;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// mov.u64         %rl3, a;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// add.s64         %rl4, %rl3, %rl2;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// mul.wide.u32    %rl5, %r2, 4;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// add.s64         %rl6, %rl4, %rl5;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ld.global.f32   %f1, &#91;%rl6&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// To reduce the register pressure, the optimization implemented in this file</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// merges the common part of a group of GEPs, so we can compute each pointer</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// address by adding a simple offset to the common part, saving many registers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// It works by splitting each GEP into a variadic base and a constant offset.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The variadic base can be computed once and reused by multiple GEPs, and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// constant offsets can be nicely folded into the reg+immediate addressing mode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (supported by most targets) without using any extra register.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For instance, we transform the four GEPs and four loads in the above example</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// into:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// base = gep a, 0, x, y</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// load base</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// load base + 1  &#42; sizeof(float)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// load base + 32 &#42; sizeof(float)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// load base + 33 &#42; sizeof(float)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Given the transformed IR, a backend that supports the reg+immediate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// addressing mode can easily fold the pointer arithmetics into the loads. For</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// example, the NVPTX backend can easily fold the pointer arithmetics into the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ld.global.f32 instructions, and the resultant PTX uses much fewer registers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// mov.u32         %r1, %tid.x;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// mov.u32         %r2, %tid.y;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// mul.wide.u32    %rl2, %r1, 128;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// mov.u64         %rl3, a;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// add.s64         %rl4, %rl3, %rl2;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// mul.wide.u32    %rl5, %r2, 4;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// add.s64         %rl6, %rl4, %rl5;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ld.global.f32   %f1, &#91;%rl6&#93;; // so far the same as unoptimized PTX</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ld.global.f32   %f2, &#91;%rl6+4&#93;; // much better</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ld.global.f32   %f3, &#91;%rl6+128&#93;; // much better</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ld.global.f32   %f4, &#91;%rl6+132&#93;; // much better</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Another improvement enabled by the LowerGEP flag is to lower a GEP with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// multiple indices to either multiple GEPs with a single index or arithmetic</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// operations (depending on whether the target uses alias analysis in codegen).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Such transformation can have following benefits:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (1) It can always extract constants in the indices of structure type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (2) After such Lowering, there are more optimization opportunities such as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     CSE, LICM and CGP.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// E.g. The following GEPs have multiple indices:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  BB1:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %p = getelementptr &#91;10 x %struct&#93;&#42; %ptr, i64 %i, i64 %j1, i32 3</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    load %p</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  BB2:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %p2 = getelementptr &#91;10 x %struct&#93;&#42; %ptr, i64 %i, i64 %j1, i32 2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    load %p2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We can not do CSE to the common part related to index &quot;i64 %i&quot;. Lowering</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// GEPs can achieve such goals.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the target does not use alias analysis in codegen, this pass will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// lower a GEP with multiple indices into arithmetic operations:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  BB1:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %1 = ptrtoint &#91;10 x %struct&#93;&#42; %ptr to i64    ; CSE opportunity</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %2 = mul i64 %i, length&#95;of&#95;10xstruct         ; CSE opportunity</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %3 = add i64 %1, %2                          ; CSE opportunity</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %4 = mul i64 %j1, length&#95;of&#95;struct</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %5 = add i64 %3, %4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %6 = add i64 %3, struct&#95;field&#95;3              ; Constant offset</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %p = inttoptr i64 %6 to i32&#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    load %p</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  BB2:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %7 = ptrtoint &#91;10 x %struct&#93;&#42; %ptr to i64    ; CSE opportunity</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %8 = mul i64 %i, length&#95;of&#95;10xstruct         ; CSE opportunity</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %9 = add i64 %7, %8                          ; CSE opportunity</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %10 = mul i64 %j2, length&#95;of&#95;struct</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %11 = add i64 %9, %10</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %12 = add i64 %11, struct&#95;field&#95;2            ; Constant offset</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %p = inttoptr i64 %12 to i32&#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    load %p2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the target uses alias analysis in codegen, this pass will lower a GEP</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with multiple indices into multiple GEPs with a single index:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  BB1:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %1 = bitcast &#91;10 x %struct&#93;&#42; %ptr to i8&#42;     ; CSE opportunity</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %2 = mul i64 %i, length&#95;of&#95;10xstruct         ; CSE opportunity</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %3 = getelementptr i8&#42; %1, i64 %2            ; CSE opportunity</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %4 = mul i64 %j1, length&#95;of&#95;struct</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %5 = getelementptr i8&#42; %3, i64 %4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %6 = getelementptr i8&#42; %5, struct&#95;field&#95;3    ; Constant offset</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %p = bitcast i8&#42; %6 to i32&#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    load %p</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  BB2:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %7 = bitcast &#91;10 x %struct&#93;&#42; %ptr to i8&#42;     ; CSE opportunity</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %8 = mul i64 %i, length&#95;of&#95;10xstruct         ; CSE opportunity</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %9 = getelementptr i8&#42; %7, i64 %8            ; CSE opportunity</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %10 = mul i64 %j2, length&#95;of&#95;struct</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %11 = getelementptr i8&#42; %9, i64 %10</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %12 = getelementptr i8&#42; %11, struct&#95;field&#95;2  ; Constant offset</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %p2 = bitcast i8&#42; %12 to i32&#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    load %p2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Lowering GEPs can also benefit other passes such as LICM and CGP.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// LICM (Loop Invariant Code Motion) can not hoist/sink a GEP of multiple</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// indices if one of the index is variant. If we lower such GEP into invariant</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// parts and variant parts, LICM can hoist/sink those invariant parts.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// CGP (CodeGen Prepare) tries to sink address calculations that match the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// target&#39;s addressing modes. A GEP with multiple indices may not match and will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// not be sunk. If we lower such GEP into smaller parts, CGP may sink some of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// them. So we end up with a better addressing mode.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/scalar/separateconstoffsetfromgep-h">llvm/Transforms/Scalar/SeparateConstOffsetFromGEP.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constant-h">llvm/IR/Constant.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/datalayout-h">llvm/IR/DataLayout.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/derivedtypes-h">llvm/IR/DerivedTypes.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201" lineLink="#a04420dee76eeabc142fb4cc165cdbaa1"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/opt">cl::opt&lt;bool&gt;</a> <a href="#a04420dee76eeabc142fb4cc165cdbaa1">DisableSeparateConstOffsetFromGEP</a>(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;disable-separate-const-offset-from-gep&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/cl/#ac12e6a8f3a1b511f0dee2ed6de0ae806">cl::init</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cl/desc">cl::desc</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Do not separate the constant offset from a GEP instruction&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/cl/#a68075925a54790e71ca790e1d4f21a40a263ac008d8d31f13ce460395fc4cf7e6">cl::Hidden</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Setting this flag may emit false positives when the input module already</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// contains dead instructions. Therefore, we set it only in unit tests that are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// free of dead code.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/opt">cl::opt&lt;bool&gt;</a></span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp-"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">namespace </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A helper class for separating a constant offset from a GEP index.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// In real programs, a GEP index may be more complicated than a simple addition</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of something and a constant integer which can be trivially splitted. For</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// example, to split ((a &lt;&lt; 3) | 5) + b, we need to search deeper for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// constant offset, so that we can separate the index to (a &lt;&lt; 3) + b and 5</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Therefore, this class looks into the expression that computes a given GEP</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// index, and tries to find a constant integer that can be hoisted to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// outermost level of the expression as an addition. Not every constant in an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// expression can jump out. e.g., we cannot transform (b &#42; (a + 5)) to (b &#42; a +</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 5); nor can we transform (3 &#42; (a + 5)) to (3 &#42; a + 5), however in this case,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// -instcombine probably already optimized (3 &#42; (a + 5)) to (3 &#42; a + 15).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp-/constantoffsetextractor"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight">ConstantOffsetExtractor &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Extracts a constant offset from the given GEP index. It returns the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// new index representing the remainder (equal to the original index minus</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the constant offset), or nullptr if we cannot extract a constant offset.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p Idx The given GEP index</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p GEP The given GEP</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p UserChainTail Outputs the tail of UserChain so that we can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                  garbage-collect unused instructions in UserChain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-separateconstoffsetfromgep-cpp-/constantoffsetextractor/#a867434c3e87f84340731c31c5e1b863d">Extract</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;Idx, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/getelementptrinst">GetElementPtrInst</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncommongep-cpp/#ad532e8710e50302e0a376b61c91fa91d">GEP</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlight">                        <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user">User</a> &#42;&amp;UserChainTail);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Looks for a constant offset from the given GEP index without extracting</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// it. It returns the numeric value of the extracted constant offset (0 if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// failed). The meaning of the arguments are the same as Extract.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> int64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcsubtargetinfo-cpp/#a08e140d603b53c440c54cffc85131c8f">Find</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;Idx, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/getelementptrinst">GetElementPtrInst</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncommongep-cpp/#ad532e8710e50302e0a376b61c91fa91d">GEP</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">private</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlight">  ConstantOffsetExtractor(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> InsertionPt)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlight">      : IP(InsertionPt), <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>(InsertionPt-&gt;getDataLayout()) &#123;&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Searches the expression that computes V for a non-zero constant C s.t.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// V can be reassociated into the form V&#39; + C. If the searching is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// successful, returns C and update UserChain as a def-use chain from C to V;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// otherwise, UserChain is empty.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p V            The given expression</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p SignExtended Whether V will be sign-extended in the computation of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                 GEP index</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p ZeroExtended Whether V will be zero-extended in the computation of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                 GEP index</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p NonNegative  Whether V is guaranteed to be non-negative. For example,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                 an index of an inbounds GEP is guaranteed to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                 non-negative. Levaraging this, we can better split</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                 inbounds GEPs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a086e9fbdb06276db7753101a08a63adf">find</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;V, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SignExtended, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ZeroExtended, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/correlatedvaluepropagation-cpp/#aad75d6f4f14a7b791076c6785aa59be4a16cb7fb563099bff249482f3a050bad8">NonNegative</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A helper function to look into both operands of a binary operator.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> findInEitherOperand(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator">BinaryOperator</a> &#42;BO, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SignExtended,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><span class="doxyHighlight">                            </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ZeroExtended);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// After finding the constant offset C from the GEP index I, we build a new</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// index I&#39; s.t. I&#39; + C = I. This function builds and returns the new</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// index I&#39; according to UserChain produced by function &quot;find&quot;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The building conceptually takes two steps:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 1) iteratively distribute s/zext towards the leaves of the expression tree</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// that computes I</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 2) reassociate the expression tree to the form I&#39; + C.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For example, to extract the 5 from sext(a + (b + 5)), we first distribute</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// sext to a, b and 5 so that we have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   sext(a) + (sext(b) + 5).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Then, we reassociate it to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   (sext(a) + sext(b)) + 5</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Given this form, we know I&#39; is sext(a) + sext(b).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;rebuildWithoutConstOffset();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// After the first step of rebuilding the GEP index without the constant</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// offset, distribute s/zext to the operands of all operators in UserChain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// e.g., zext(sext(a + (b + 5)) (assuming no overflow) =&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// zext(sext(a)) + (zext(sext(b)) + zext(sext(5))).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The function also updates UserChain to point to new subexpressions after</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// distributing s/zext. e.g., the old UserChain of the above example is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 5 -&gt; b + 5 -&gt; a + (b + 5) -&gt; sext(...) -&gt; zext(sext(...)),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and the new UserChain is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// zext(sext(5)) -&gt; zext(sext(b)) + zext(sext(5)) -&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   zext(sext(a)) + (zext(sext(b)) + zext(sext(5))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p ChainIndex The index to UserChain. ChainIndex is initially</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///               UserChain.size() - 1, and is decremented during</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///               the recursion.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;distributeExtsAndCloneChain(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ChainIndex);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Reassociates the GEP index to the form I&#39; + C and returns I&#39;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;removeConstOffset(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ChainIndex);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A helper function to apply ExtInsts, a list of s/zext, to value V.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A helper function that returns whether we can trace into the operands</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><span class="doxyHighlight">                    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/correlatedvaluepropagation-cpp/#aad75d6f4f14a7b791076c6785aa59be4a16cb7fb563099bff249482f3a050bad8">NonNegative</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The path from the constant offset to the old GEP index. e.g., if the GEP</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// index is &quot;a &#42; b + (c + 5)&quot;. After running function find, UserChain&#91;0&#93; will</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This path helps to rebuild the new GEP index.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;User &#42;, 8&gt;</a> UserChain;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A pass that tries to split every GEP in the function into a variadic</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// base and a constant offset. It is a FunctionPass because searching for the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Canonicalize array indices to pointer-size integers. This helps to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// simplify the logic of splitting a GEP. For example, if a + b is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// pointer-size integer, we have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   gep base, a + b = gep (gep base, a), b</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// However, this equality may not hold if the size of a + b is smaller than</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the pointer size, because LLVM conceptually sign-extends GEP indices to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// pointer size before computing the address</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// (http://llvm.org/docs/LangRef.html#id181).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This canonicalization is very likely already done in clang and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// instcombine. Therefore, the program will probably remain the same.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="438"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Returns true if the module changes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Verified in @i32&#95;add in split-gep.ll</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> canonicalizeArrayIndicesToIndexSize(GetElementPtrInst &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncommongep-cpp/#ad532e8710e50302e0a376b61c91fa91d">GEP</a>);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ConstantOffsetExtractor::CanTraceInto(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SignExtended,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                            </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ZeroExtended,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                            <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator">BinaryOperator</a> &#42;BO,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                            </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/correlatedvaluepropagation-cpp/#aad75d6f4f14a7b791076c6785aa59be4a16cb7fb563099bff249482f3a050bad8">NonNegative</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We only consider ADD, SUB and OR, because a non-zero constant found in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// expressions composed of these operations can be easily hoisted as a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// constant offset by reassociation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator/#a31bf07f3f61525486633bc1d0bbaf029">getOpcode</a>() != Instruction::Add &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><span class="doxyHighlight">      BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator/#a31bf07f3f61525486633bc1d0bbaf029">getOpcode</a>() != Instruction::Sub &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><span class="doxyHighlight">      BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator/#a31bf07f3f61525486633bc1d0bbaf029">getOpcode</a>() != Instruction::Or) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a> = BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user/#aa0a2cb1582d1cec317bd205085469ca1">getOperand</a>(0), &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a> = BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user/#aa0a2cb1582d1cec317bd205085469ca1">getOperand</a>(1);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Do not trace into &quot;or&quot; unless it is equivalent to &quot;add&quot;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is the case if the or&#39;s disjoint flag is set.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator/#a31bf07f3f61525486633bc1d0bbaf029">getOpcode</a>() == Instruction::Or &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><span class="doxyHighlight">      !<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;PossiblyDisjointInst&gt;</a>(BO)-&gt;isDisjoint())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: We don&#39;t currently support constants from the RHS of subs,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// when we are zero-extended, because we need a way to zero-extended</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// them before they are negated.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="534"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (ZeroExtended &amp;&amp; !SignExtended &amp;&amp; BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator/#a31bf07f3f61525486633bc1d0bbaf029">getOpcode</a>() == Instruction::Sub)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="535"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="536"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="537"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In addition, tracing into BO requires that its surrounding s/zext (if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="538"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// any) is distributable to both operands.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Suppose BO = A op B.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="541"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  SignExtended | ZeroExtended | Distributable?</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="542"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// --------------+--------------+----------------------------------</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="543"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       0       |      0       | true because no s/zext exists</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="544"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       0       |      1       | zext(BO) == zext(A) op zext(B)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="545"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       1       |      0       | sext(BO) == sext(A) op sext(B)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="546"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       1       |      1       | zext(sext(BO)) ==</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="547"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//               |              |     zext(sext(A)) op zext(sext(B))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="548"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator/#a31bf07f3f61525486633bc1d0bbaf029">getOpcode</a>() == Instruction::Add &amp;&amp; !ZeroExtended &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/correlatedvaluepropagation-cpp/#aad75d6f4f14a7b791076c6785aa59be4a16cb7fb563099bff249482f3a050bad8">NonNegative</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="549"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If a + b &gt;= 0 and (a &gt;= 0 or b &gt;= 0), then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="550"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   sext(a + b) = sext(a) + sext(b)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="551"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// even if the addition is not marked nsw.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="552"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="553"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Leveraging this invariant, we can trace into an sext&#39;ed inbound GEP</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="554"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// index if the constant offset is non-negative.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="555"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="556"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Verified in @sext&#95;add in split-gep.ll.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="557"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantint">ConstantInt</a> &#42;ConstLHS = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;ConstantInt&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="558"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!ConstLHS-&gt;isNegative())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="559"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="560"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="561"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantint">ConstantInt</a> &#42;ConstRHS = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;ConstantInt&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="562"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!ConstRHS-&gt;isNegative())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="563"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00564" /><CodeLine lineNumber="564"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="565"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00566" /><CodeLine lineNumber="566"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00567" /><CodeLine lineNumber="567"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// sext (add/sub nsw A, B) == add/sub nsw (sext A), (sext B)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="568"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// zext (add/sub nuw A, B) == add/sub nuw (zext A), (zext B)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00569" /><CodeLine lineNumber="569"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator/#a31bf07f3f61525486633bc1d0bbaf029">getOpcode</a>() == Instruction::Add ||</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="570"><span class="doxyHighlight">      BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator/#a31bf07f3f61525486633bc1d0bbaf029">getOpcode</a>() == Instruction::Sub) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (SignExtended &amp;&amp; !BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#a350f4fdc01c770b5cf6a8be2624ae3e5">hasNoSignedWrap</a>())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="572"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (ZeroExtended &amp;&amp; !BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#a100c666f9253331dd1d166a863248326">hasNoUnsignedWrap</a>())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="574"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="579"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> ConstantOffsetExtractor::findInEitherOperand(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator">BinaryOperator</a> &#42;BO,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                                   </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SignExtended,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="582"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                                   </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ZeroExtended) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Save off the current height of the chain, in case we need to restore it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ChainLength = UserChain.size();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// BO being non-negative does not shed light on whether its operands are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// non-negative. Clear the NonNegative flag here.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> ConstantOffset = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a086e9fbdb06276db7753101a08a63adf">find</a>(BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user/#aa0a2cb1582d1cec317bd205085469ca1">getOperand</a>(0), SignExtended, ZeroExtended,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><span class="doxyHighlight">                              </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42; NonNegative &#42;/</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we found a constant offset in the left operand, stop and return that.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This shortcut might cause us to miss opportunities of combining the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// constant offsets in both operands, e.g., (a + 4) + (b + 5) =&gt; (a + b) + 9</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="593"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// However, such cases are probably already handled by -instcombine,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="594"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// given this pass runs after the standard optimizations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (ConstantOffset != 0) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ConstantOffset;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Reset the chain back to where it was when we started exploring this node,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// since visiting the LHS didn&#39;t pan out.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599"><span class="doxyHighlight">  UserChain.resize(ChainLength);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="600"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="601"><span class="doxyHighlight">  ConstantOffset = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a086e9fbdb06276db7753101a08a63adf">find</a>(BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user/#aa0a2cb1582d1cec317bd205085469ca1">getOperand</a>(1), SignExtended, ZeroExtended,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="602"><span class="doxyHighlight">                        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42; NonNegative &#42;/</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="603"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If U is a sub operator, negate the constant offset found in the right</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="604"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// operand.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="605"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator/#a31bf07f3f61525486633bc1d0bbaf029">getOpcode</a>() == Instruction::Sub)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="606"><span class="doxyHighlight">    ConstantOffset = -ConstantOffset;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="607"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="608"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If RHS wasn&#39;t a suitable candidate either, reset the chain again.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="609"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (ConstantOffset == 0)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="610"><span class="doxyHighlight">    UserChain.resize(ChainLength);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="611"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="612"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ConstantOffset;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="613"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="614"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="615"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> ConstantOffsetExtractor::find(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;V, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SignExtended,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="616"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ZeroExtended, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/correlatedvaluepropagation-cpp/#aad75d6f4f14a7b791076c6785aa59be4a16cb7fb563099bff249482f3a050bad8">NonNegative</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="617"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO(jingyue): We could trace into integer/pointer casts, such as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="618"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// inttoptr, ptrtoint, bitcast, and addrspacecast. We choose to handle only</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="619"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// integers because it gives good enough results for our benchmarks.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="626"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> ConstantOffset(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abee0df5f7f703bb4462aba260ba0a60f">BitWidth</a>, 0);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="627"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantint">ConstantInt</a> &#42;CI = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;ConstantInt&gt;</a>(V)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="628"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Hooray, we found it!</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="629"><span class="doxyHighlight">    ConstantOffset = CI-&gt;getValue();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="630"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator">BinaryOperator</a> &#42;BO = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;BinaryOperator&gt;</a>(V)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00644" /><CodeLine lineNumber="644"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00645" /><CodeLine lineNumber="645"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Clear the NonNegative flag, because zext(a) &gt;= 0 does not imply a &gt;= 0</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00649" /><CodeLine lineNumber="649"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00650" /><CodeLine lineNumber="650"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00651" /><CodeLine lineNumber="651"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we found a non-zero constant offset, add it to the path for</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00679" /><CodeLine lineNumber="679"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;ConstantOffsetExtractor::rebuildWithoutConstOffset() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00680" /><CodeLine lineNumber="680"><span class="doxyHighlight">  distributeExtsAndCloneChain(UserChain.size() - 1);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00681" /><CodeLine lineNumber="681"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Remove all nullptrs (used to be s/zext) from UserChain.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="754"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (BO-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator/#a31bf07f3f61525486633bc1d0bbaf029">getOpcode</a>() == Instruction::Or) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="755"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Rebuild &quot;or&quot; as &quot;add&quot;, because &quot;or&quot; may be invalid for the new</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="756"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// expression.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="757"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="758"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For instance, given</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="759"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   a | (b + 5) where a and b + 5 have no common bits,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="760"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// we can extract 5 as the constant offset.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="761"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="762"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// However, reusing the &quot;or&quot; in the new index would give us</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="763"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   (a | b) + 5</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="764"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// which does not equal a | (b + 5).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="765"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="766"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Replacing the &quot;or&quot; with &quot;add&quot; is fine, because</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="767"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   a | (b + 5) = a + (b + 5) = (a + b) + 5</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="768"><span class="doxyHighlight">    NewOp = Instruction::Add;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="769"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="770"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00791" /><CodeLine lineNumber="791"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1055"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Remove the constant offset in each sequential index. The resultant GEP</span></CodeLine>
