<Link id="l01079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1079"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and the old index if they are not used.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1080"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1106b8a15061e8494873e10bb8a364e5">RecursivelyDeleteTriviallyDeadInstructions</a>(UserChainTail);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1081"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1106b8a15061e8494873e10bb8a364e5">RecursivelyDeleteTriviallyDeadInstructions</a>(OldIdx);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1082"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1083"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1084"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1085"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1086"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Clear the inbounds attribute because the new index may be off-bound.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1087"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// e.g.,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1088"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1089"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   b     = add i64 a, 5</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1090"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   addr  = gep inbounds float, float&#42; p, i64 b</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1091"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1092"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is transformed to:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1093"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1094"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   addr2 = gep float, float&#42; p, i64 a ; inbounds removed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1095"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   addr  = gep inbounds float, float&#42; addr2, i64 5</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1096"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1097"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If a is -4, although the old index b is in bounds, the new index a is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1098"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// off-bound. http://llvm.org/docs/LangRef.html#id181 says &quot;if the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1099"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// inbounds keyword is not present, the offsets are added to the base</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1100"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// address with silently-wrapping two&#39;s complement arithmetic&quot;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1101"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Therefore, the final code will be a semantically equivalent.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1102"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1103"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO(jingyue): do some range analysis to keep as many inbounds as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1104"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// possible. GEPs with inbounds are more friendly to alias analysis.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1105"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO(gep&#95;nowrap): Preserve nuw at least.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1106"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> GEPWasInBounds = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncommongep-cpp/#ad532e8710e50302e0a376b61c91fa91d">GEP</a>-&gt;isInBounds();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1107"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncommongep-cpp/#ad532e8710e50302e0a376b61c91fa91d">GEP</a>-&gt;setNoWrapFlags(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gepnowrapflags/#ad41d3c975038ec4a4fc791601729124e">GEPNoWrapFlags::none</a>());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1108"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1109"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Lowers a GEP to either GEPs with a single index or arithmetic operations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1110"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (LowerGEP) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1111"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// As currently BasicAA does not analyze ptrtoint/inttoptr, do not lower to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1112"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// arithmetic operations if the target uses alias analysis in codegen.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1113"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Additionally, pointers that aren&#39;t integral (and so can&#39;t be safely</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1114"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// converted to integers) or those whose offset size is different from their</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1115"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pointer size (which means that doing integer arithmetic on them could</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1116"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// affect that data) can&#39;t be lowered in this way.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1117"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> AddrSpace = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncommongep-cpp/#ad532e8710e50302e0a376b61c91fa91d">GEP</a>-&gt;getPointerAddressSpace();</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1131"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1211"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Because we process the basic blocks in pre-order of the dominator tree, a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1212"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// candidate that doesn&#39;t dominate the current instruction won&#39;t dominate any</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1213"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// future instruction either. Therefore, we pop it out of the stack. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1214"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// optimization makes the algorithm O(n).</span></CodeLine>
